query\n    ) external pure returns (bool);\n\n    function hasVintage(\n        uint256 id,\n        uint256 min,\n        uint256 max\n    ) external pure returns (bool);\n\n    function hasFuel(uint256 id, uint256 query) external view returns (bool);\n\n    function hasCertificateType(uint256 id, uint256 query) external view returns (bool);\n\n    function hasEndorsement(uint256 id, uint256 query) external view returns (bool);\n}\n","keccak256":"0x2a84d8560fcc5976e929ed9ef86b48df5d979604b349d015f9f5912418640dbf","license":"BUSL-1.1"},"contracts/interfaces/errors/JasmineErrors.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.0;\n\n\n/**\n * @title Jasmine Errors\n * @author Kai Aldag<kai.aldag@jasmine.energy>\n * @notice Convenience interface for errors omitted by Jasmine's smart contracts\n * @custom:security-contact dev@jasmine.energy\n */\ninterface JasmineErrors {\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  General Errors  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  \\\\\n\n    /// @dev Emitted if input is invalid\n    error InvalidInput();\n\n    /// @dev Emitted if internal validation failed\n    error ValidationFailed();\n\n    /// @dev Emitted if function is disabled\n    error Disabled();\n\n    /// @dev Emitted if contract does not support metadata version\n    error UnsupportedMetadataVersion(uint8 metadataVersion);\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  Access Control Errors  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  \\\\\n\n    /// @dev Emitted if access control check fails\n    error RequiresRole(bytes32 role);\n\n    /// @dev Emitted for unauthorized actions\n    error Prohibited();\n}\n","keccak256":"0xf7d6476297045c5799a21c24560fa4ffd377209b6a0b617685fe67a076548662","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/pool/IEATBackedPool.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.0;\n\n\n/**\n * @title Jasmine EAT Backed Pool Interface\n * @author Kai Aldag<kai.aldag@jasmine.energy>\n * @notice Contains functionality and events for pools which issue JLTs for EATs\n *         deposits and permit withdrawals of EATs.\n * @dev Due to linearization issues, ERC-20 and ERC-1155 Receiver are not enforced\n *      conformances - but likely should be.\n * @custom:security-contact dev@jasmine.energy\n */\ninterface IJasmineEATBackedPool {\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    //  Events\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Emitted whenever EATs are deposited to the contract\n     * \n     * @param operator Initiator of the deposit\n     * @param owner Token holder depositting to contract\n     * @param quantity Number of EATs deposited. Note: JLTs issued are 1-1 with EATs\n     */\n    event Deposit(\n        address indexed operator,\n        address indexed owner,\n        uint256 quantity\n    );\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Emitted whenever EATs are withdrawn from the contract\n     * \n     * @param sender Initiator of the deposit\n     * @param receiver Token holder depositting to contract\n     * @param quantity Number of EATs withdrawn.\n     */\n    event Withdraw(\n        address indexed sender,\n        address indexed receiver,\n        uint256 quantity\n    );\n\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    //  Deposit and Withdraw Functionality\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Used to deposit EATs into the pool to receive JLTs.\n     * \n     * @dev Requirements:\n     *     - Pool must be an approved operator of from address\n     * \n     * @param tokenId EAT token ID to deposit\n     * @param quantity Number of EATs for given tokenId to deposit\n     * \n     * @return jltQuantity Number of JLTs issued for deposit\n     * \n     * Emits a {Deposit} event.\n     */\n    function deposit(\n        uint256 tokenId, \n        uint256 quantity\n    ) external returns (uint256 jltQuantity);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Used to deposit EATs from another account into the pool to receive JLTs.\n     * \n     * @dev Requirements:\n     *     - Pool must be an approved operator of from address\n     *     - msg.sender must be approved for the user's tokens\n     * \n     * @param from Address from which to transfer EATs to pool\n     * @param tokenId EAT token ID to deposit\n     * @param quantity Number of EATs for given tokenId to deposit\n     * \n     * @return jltQuantity Number of JLTs issued for deposit\n     * \n     * Emits a {Deposit} event.\n     */\n    function depositFrom(\n        address from, \n        uint256 tokenId, \n        uint256 quantity\n    ) external returns (uint256 jltQuantity);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Used to deposit numerous EATs of different IDs\n     * into the pool to receive JLTs.\n     * \n     * @dev Requirements:\n     *     - Pool must be an approved operator of from address\n     *     - Lenght of tokenIds and quantities must match\n     * \n     * @param from Address from which to transfer EATs to pool\n     * @param tokenIds EAT token IDs to deposit\n     * @param quantities Number of EATs for tokenId at same index to deposit\n     * \n     * @return jltQuantity Number of JLTs issued for deposit\n     * \n     * Emits a {Deposit} event.\n     */\n    function depositBatch(\n        address from, \n        uint256[] calldata tokenIds, \n        uint256[] calldata quantities\n    ) external returns (uint256 jltQuantity);\n\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Withdraw EATs from pool by burning 'quantity' of JLTs from 'owner'.\n     * \n     * @dev Pool will automatically select EATs to withdraw. Defer to {withdrawSpecific}\n     *      if selecting specific EATs to withdraw is important.\n     * \n     * @dev Requirements:\n     *     - msg.sender must have sufficient JLTs\n     *     - If recipient is a contract, it must implement onERC1155Received & onERC1155BatchReceived\n     * \n     * @param recipient Address to receive withdrawn EATs\n     * @param quantity Number of JLTs to withdraw\n     * @param data Optional calldata to relay to recipient via onERC1155Received\n     * \n     * @return tokenIds Token IDs withdrawn from the pool\n     * @return amounts Number of tokens withdraw, per ID, from the pool\n     * \n     * Emits a {Withdraw} event.\n     */\n    function withdraw(\n        address recipient, \n        uint256 quantity, \n        bytes calldata data\n    ) external returns (uint256[] memory tokenIds, uint256[] memory amounts);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Withdraw EATs from pool by burning 'quantity' of JLTs from 'owner'.\n     * \n     * @dev Pool will automatically select EATs to withdraw. Defer to {withdrawSpecific}\n     *      if selecting specific EATs to withdraw is important.\n     * \n     * @dev Requirements:\n     *     - msg.sender must be approved for owner's JLTs\n     *     - Owner must have sufficient JLTs\n     *     - If recipient is a contract, it must implement onERC1155Received & onERC1155BatchReceived\n     * \n     * @param spender JLT owner from which to burn tokens\n     * @param recipient Address to receive withdrawn EATs\n     * @param quantity Number of JLTs to withdraw\n     * @param data Optional calldata to relay to recipient via onERC1155Received\n     * \n     * @return tokenIds Token IDs withdrawn from the pool\n     * @return amounts Number of tokens withdraw, per ID, from the pool\n     * \n     * Emits a {Withdraw} event.\n     */\n    function withdrawFrom(\n        address spender, \n        address recipient, \n        uint256 quantity, \n        bytes calldata data\n    ) external returns (uint256[] memory tokenIds, uint256[] memory amounts);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Withdraw specific EATs from pool by burning the sum of 'quantities' in JLTs from 'owner'.\n     * \n     * @dev Requirements:\n     *     - msg.sender must be approved for owner's JLTs\n     *     - Length of tokenIds and quantities must match\n     *     - Owner must have more JLTs than sum of quantities\n     *     - If recipient is a contract, it must implement onERC1155Received & onERC1155BatchReceived\n     *     - Owner and Recipient cannot be zero address\n     * \n     * @param spender JLT owner from which to burn tokens\n     * @param recipient Address to receive withdrawn EATs\n     * @param tokenIds EAT token IDs to withdraw from pool\n     * @param quantities Number of EATs for tokenId at same index to deposit\n     * @param data Optional calldata to relay to recipient via onERC1155Received\n     * \n     * Emits a {Withdraw} event.\n     */\n    function withdrawSpecific(\n        address spender, \n        address recipient, \n        uint256[] calldata tokenIds, \n        uint256[] calldata quantities, \n        bytes calldata data\n    ) external;\n\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    //  Costing Functions\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Cost of withdrawing specified amounts of tokens from pool.\n     * \n     * @param tokenIds IDs of EATs to withdaw\n     * @param amounts Amounts of EATs to withdaw\n     * \n     * @return cost Price of withdrawing EATs in JLTs\n     */\n    function withdrawalCost(\n        uint256[] memory tokenIds,\n        uint256[] memory amounts\n    ) external view returns (uint256 cost);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Cost of withdrawing amount of tokens from pool where pool\n     *         selects the tokens to withdraw.\n     * \n     * @param amount Number of EATs to withdraw.\n     * \n     * @return cost Price of withdrawing EATs in JLTs\n     */\n    function withdrawalCost(uint256 amount) external view returns (uint256 cost);\n}\n","keccak256":"0xc066b2413fd9818f9ec85bf473ac3b1ce7c964a079e9d9bd43a23c08adb71a47","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/pool/IQualifiedPool.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.0;\n\n\n/**\n * @title Jasmine Qualified Pool Interface\n * @author Kai Aldag<kai.aldag@jasmine.energy>\n * @notice Interface for any pool that has a deposit policy\n * which constrains deposits.\n * @custom:security-contact dev@jasmine.energy\n */\ninterface IJasmineQualifiedPool {\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    //  Errors\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n\n    /// @dev Emitted if a token does not meet pool's deposit policy\n    error Unqualified(uint256 tokenId);\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    //  Qualification Functions\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n\n if token meets policy and may be deposited. * \n     * @param metadataVersion Version of metadata to return policy for\n     * \n     * @return policy Deposit policy for given metadata version\n     */\n\tfunction policyForVersion(uint8 MIT\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.0;\n\n//  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  Imports  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  \\\\\n\n// Jasmine Type Conformances\nimport { IJasmineEATBackedPool as IEATBackedPool } from \"./IEATBackedPool.sol\";\n\n\n/**\n * @title Jasmine Retireable Pool Interface\n * @author Kai Aldag<kai.aldag@jasmine.energy>\n * @notice Extends pools with retirement functionality and events.\n * @custom:security-contact dev@jasmine.energy\n */\ninterface IJasmineRetireablePool is IEATBackedPool {\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    //  Events\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n\n    /**\n     * @notice emitted when tokens from a pool are retired\n     * \n     * @dev must be accompanied by a token burn event\n     * \n     * @param operator Initiator of retirement\n     * @param beneficiary Designate beneficiary of retirement\n     * @param quantity Number of JLT being retired\n     */\n    event Retirement(\n        address indexed operator,\n        address indexed beneficiary,\n        uint256 quantity\n    );\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    //  Retirement Functionality\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Burns 'quantity' of tokens from 'owner' in the name of 'beneficiary'.\n     * \n     * @dev Internally, calls are routed to Retirement Service to facilitate the retirement.\n     * \n     * @dev Emits a {Retirement} event.\n     * \n     * @dev Requirements:\n     *     - msg.sender must be approved for owner's JLTs\n     *     - Owner must have sufficient JLTs\n     *     - Owner cannot be zero address\n     * \n     * @param from JLT owner from which to burn tokens\n     * @param beneficiary Address to receive retirement acknowledgment. If none, assume msg.sender\n     * @param amount Number of JLTs to withdraw\n     * @param data Optional calldata to relay to retirement service via onERC1155Received\n     * \n     */\n    function retire(\n        address from, \n        address beneficiary, \n        uint256 amount, \n        bytes calldata data\n    ) external;\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Cost of retiring JLTs from pool.\n     * \n     * @param amount Amount of JLTs to retire.\n     * \n     * @return cost Price of retiring in JLTs.\n     */\n    function retirementCost(uint256 amount) external view returns (uint256 cost);\n}\n","keccak256":"0x1954cabccba1bb9db131113bc1a704508219aa265b7ad665b42aab1222e426e9","license":"MIT"},"contracts/libraries/PoolPolicy.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: BUSL-1.1\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.0;\n\n//  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  Imports  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  \\\\\n\nimport { IJasmineOracle } from \"../interfaces/core/IJasmineOracle.sol\";\n\n\n/**\n * @title Jasmine Pool Policy Library\n * @author Kai Aldag<kai.aldag@jasmine.energy>\n * @notice Utility library for Pool Policy types\n * @custom:security-contact dev@jasmine.energy\n */\nlibrary PoolPolicy {\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    //  Constants\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n\n    /// @dev Use this value in DepositPolicy to set no constraints for attribute\n    uint32 internal constant ANY_VALUE = type(uint32).max;\n\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    //  Types\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n\n    /**\n     * @title Deposit Policy\n     * @notice A deposit policy is a pool's constraints on what EATs may be deposited. \n     * @dev Only supports metadata V1\n     * @dev Due to EAT metadata attribytes being zero indexed, to specify no deposit  \n     *      constraints for a given attribute, use `ANY_VALUE` constant.\n     *      NOTE: This applies for vintage period as well.\n     */\n    struct DepositPolicy {\n        uint56[2] vintagePeriod;\n        uint32 techType;\n        uint32 registry;\n        uint32 certificateType;\n        uint32 endorsement;\n    }\n\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    //  Utility Functions\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  Policy Utilities  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  \\\\\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Checks if a given EAT meets a given policy by querying the Jasmine Oracle\n     * \n     * @param policy An eligibility cretieria for an EAT\n     * @param oracle The Jasmine Oracle contract to query against\n     * @param tokenId The EAT for which to check eligibility\n     */\n    function meetsPolicy(\n        DepositPolicy storage policy,\n        IJasmineOracle oracle,\n        uint256 tokenId\n    ) \n        internal view \n        returns (bool isEligible) \n    {\n        // 1. If policy's vintage is not empty, check token has vintage\n        if (policy.vintagePeriod[0] != ANY_VALUE &&\n            policy.vintagePeriod[1] != ANY_VALUE &&\n            !oracle.hasVintage(tokenId, policy.vintagePeriod[0], policy.vintagePeriod[1])) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        // 2. If techType is not empty, check token has tech type\n        if (policy.techType != ANY_VALUE &&\n            !oracle.hasFuel(tokenId, policy.techType)) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        // 3. If registry is not empty, check token has registry\n        if (policy.registry != ANY_VALUE &&\n            !oracle.hasRegistry(tokenId, policy.registry)) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        // 4. If certificateType is not empty, check token has certificateType\n        if (policy.certificateType != ANY_VALUE &&\n            !oracle.hasCertificateType(tokenId, policy.certificateType)) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        // 5. If endorsement is not empty, check token has endorsement\n        if (policy.endorsement != ANY_VALUE &&\n            !oracle.hasEndorsement(tokenId, policy.endorsement)) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        // 6. If above checks pass, token meets policy\n        return true;\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x4fde518164542b013255e3406fb08e6fc7edc5d355f024684514ae242b2bb276","license":"BUSL-1.1"}},"version":1}

MustSupportInterface(bytes4).details: Emitted for failed supportsInterface check - per ERC-165

NoPool().details: Emitted if no pool(s) meet query

PoolExists(address).details: Emitted if a pool exists with given policy

RequiresRole(bytes32).details: Emitted if access control check fails

UnsupportedMetadataVersion(uint8).details: Emitted if contract does not support metadata version

AdminChanged(address,address).details: Emitted when the admin account has changed.

BaseRetirementFeeUpdate(uint96,address).details: Emitted whenever fee manager updates retirement rate

params.retirementRateBips: new retirement rate in basis points

BaseWithdrawalFeeUpdate(uint96,address,b.details: Emitted whenever fee manager updates withdrawal rate

params.specific: Specifies whether new rate applies to specific or any withdrawals
params.withdrawRateBips: New withdrawal rate in basis points

BeaconUpgraded(address).details: Emitted when the beacon is changed.

Initialized(uint8).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

params.poolImplementation: Address of newly supported pool implementation
params.poolIndex: Index of new pool in set of pool implementations
Index of deleted pool in set of pool implementations
Index of new pool in set of pool implementations

RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32.details: Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted signaling this. _Available since v3.1._

RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call, an admin role bearer except when using {AccessControl-_setupRole}.

RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)

Upgraded(address).details: Emitted when the implementation is upgraded.

acceptOwnership().details: The new owner accepts the ownership transfer.

params.newPoolImplementation: New pool implementation address to support

computePoolAddress(bytes32).details: Requirements:     - Policy hash must exist in existing pools

params.policyHash: Policy hash of pool to compute address of

deployNewBasePool((uint56[2],uint32,uint.details: Pool is deployed via ERC-1967 proxy to deterministic address derived from      hash of Deposit Policy Requirements:     - Caller must be owner     - Policy must not exist

params.initialSqrtPriceX96: Initial Uniswap price of pool. If 0, no Uniswap pool will be deployed
params.name: Token name of new pool (per ERC-20)
params.symbol: Token symbol of new pool (per ERC-20)

deployNewPool(uint256,bytes4,bytes,strin.details: initData must omit method selector, name and symbol. These arguments      are encoded automatically as:        selector  initData  name     symbol      (bytes4)  (bytes)   (bytes)  (bytes)     Requirements:     - Caller must be owner     - Policy must not exist     - Version must be valid pool implementation index Throws PoolExists(address pool) on failure

params.initData: Initializer data (excluding method selector, name and symbol)
params.initialSqrtPriceX96: Initial Uniswap price of pool. If 0, no Uniswap pool will be deployed
params.name: New pool's token name
params.version: Index of pool implementation to deploy

eligiblePoolsForToken(uint256).details: Runs in O(n) with respect to number of pools and does not support      a max count. This should only be used by off-chain services and      should not be called by other smart contracts due to the potentially      unlimited gas that may be spent.

params.tokenId: EAT token ID to check for eligible pools

returns.pools: List of pool addresses token meets eligibility criteria

params.index: Index of the deployed pool in set of pools

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

hasFeeManagerRole(address).details: Checks if account has pool fee manager roll

params.account: Account to check fee manager roll against

initialize(address,address,address,addre.details: UUPS initializer to set feilds, setup access control roles,     transfer ownership to initial owner, and add an initial pool

params._feeBeneficiary: Address to receive all pool fees
params._feeManager: Address of initial fee manager. May be zero address
params._owner: Address to receive initial ownership of contract
params._poolManager: Address of initial pool manager. May be zero address
params._tokensBaseURI: Base URI of used for ERC-1046 token URI function

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pendingOwner().details: Returns the address of the pending owner.

poolsBaseURI().details: Used by pools to return their respect tokenURI functions

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

params.implementationsIndex: Index of pool to undo removal

removePoolImplementation(uint256).details: Marks a pool implementation as deprecated. This is a soft delete      preventing new pool deployments from using the implementation while      allowing upgrades to occur. emits PoolImplementationRemoved

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

setBaseRetirementRate(uint96).details: Requirements:     - Caller must have fee manager role emits BaseRetirementFeeUpdate

params.newRetirementRate: New base rate for retirements in basis points

setBaseWithdrawalRate(uint96).details: Requirements:     - Caller must have fee manager role emits BaseWithdrawalFeeUpdate

params.newWithdrawalRate: New base rate for withdrawals in basis points

setBaseWithdrawalSpecificRate(uint96).details: Requirements:     - Caller must have fee manager role     - Specific rate must be greater than base rate emits BaseWithdrawalFeeUpdate

params.newWithdrawalRate: New base rate for withdrawals in basis points

setFeeBeneficiary(address).details: Requirements:     - Caller must have fee manager role     - New beneficiary cannot be zero address emits BaseWithdrawalFeeUpdate & BaseRetirementFeeUpdate

params.newFeeBeneficiary: Address to receive all pool JLT fees

transferOwnership(address).details: Starts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one. Can only be called by the current owner.

updatePoolsBaseURI(string).details: No validation is done on the new URI. Onus is on caller to ensure the new      URI is valid emits PoolsBaseURIChanged

params.newPoolsURI: New base endpoint for pools to point to

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

FEE_MANAGER_ROLE.details: Access control roll for pool fee management

POOL_MANAGER_ROLE.details: Access control roll for managers of pool implementations and deployments

UNISWAP_FEE_TIER.details: Default fee tier for Uniswap V3 pools. Default is 0.3%

_deprecatedPoolImplementations.details: Mapping of pool implementation versions to whether they are deprecated

_poolBeacons.details: Pool beacon proxy addresses containing pool implementations

_poolVersions.details: Mapping of Deposit Policy (aka pool init data) hash to _poolImplementations      index. Used to determine CREATE2 address

_pools.details: List of pool deposit policy hashes. As pools are deployed via create2,      address of a pool from the hash can be computed as needed.

_poolsBaseURI.details: Base API route from which pool information may be obtained

baseRetirementRate.details: Default fee for retirements across pools. May be overridden per pool

baseWithdrawalRate.details: Default fee for withdrawals across pools. May be overridden per pool

baseWithdrawalSpecificRate.details: Default fee for withdrawing specific EATs from pools. May be overridden per pool

uniswapFactory.details: Address of Uniswap V3 Factory to automatically deploy JLT liquidity pools

usdc.details: Address of USDC contract used to create UniSwap V3 pools for new JLTs

PoolCreated(bytes,address,string,string).notice: Emitted when a new Jasmine pool is created

PoolImplementationAdded(address,address,.notice: Emitted when new pool implementations are supported by factory

PoolImplementationRemoved(address,uint25.notice: Emitted when a pool implementations is removed

PoolImplementationUpgraded(address,addre.notice: Emitted when a pool's beacon implementation updates

PoolsBaseURIChanged(string,string).notice: Emitted whenever the pools' base token URI is updated

addPoolImplementation(address).notice: Used to add a new pool implementation

computePoolAddress(bytes32).notice: Utility function to calculate deployed address of a pool from its         policy hash

constructor.notice: Constructor to set immutable external addresses

deployNewBasePool((uint56[2],uint32,uint.notice: Deploys a new pool with given deposit policy

deployNewPool(uint256,bytes4,bytes,strin.notice: Deploys a new pool from list of pool implementations

eligiblePoolsForToken(uint256).notice: Gets a list of Jasmine pool addresses that an EAT is eligible         to be deposited into.

getPoolAtIndex(uint256).notice: Used to obtain the address of a pool in the set of pools - if it exists

poolsBaseURI().notice: Base API endpoint from which a pool's information may be obtained         by appending token symbol to end

readdPoolImplementation(uint256).notice: Used to undo a pool implementation removal

removePoolImplementation(uint256).notice: Used to remove a pool implementation

setBaseRetirementRate(uint96).notice: Allows pool fee managers to update the base retirement rate across pools

setBaseWithdrawalRate(uint96).notice: Allows pool fee managers to update the base withdrawal rate across pools

setBaseWithdrawalSpecificRate(uint96).notice: Allows pool fee managers to update the base withdrawal rate across pools

setFeeBeneficiary(address).notice: Allows pool fee managers to update the beneficiary to receive pool fees         across all Jasmine pools

totalPools().notice: Returns the total number of pools deployed

updateImplementationAddress(address,uint.notice: Allows owner to update a pool implementation

updatePoolsBaseURI(string).notice: Allows pool managers to update the base URI of pools

userdoc.notice: Deploys new Jasmine Reference Pools, manages pool implementations and         controls fees across the Jasmine protocol
